messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] HEM in NZ
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Helen...I am updating my bookmarks ect..  Sorry if i caused confusion. I think HEM is the best magazine out there for homeschooling, and especially for
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Helen...I am updating my bookmarks ect.. Sorry if i caused confusion.

I think HEM is the best magazine out there for homeschooling, and especially
for unschooling with my little ones... It is soooo wonderful.
I don't want to give the impression it is just for younger kids though...
There is much info about older kids too. I love that info too. After all,
my kids are growing by leaps and bounds each day.
Thank Helen for correcting me, and for your wonderful magazine which really
enriches my (our) life.
Ann

messages.subject: HEM in NZ
messages.msgSnippet: ... That s our old web address, Ann, from when we were still publishing books on homeschooling. We ve connected it to our magazine site, but to go directly
messages.messageBody:
At 1:48 AM +0000 3/29/01, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:
>Message: 7
> Date: Wed, 28 Mar 2001 13:02:18 -0500
> From: "A. Yates" <hooperck@...>
>Subject: Home Education Magazine
>
>I sent the web page to this list. I think that was a woopsie!! I don't
>think that works!
>So, I'll just type in the link...
>Here Linda
>You can find info on the magazine, and subscribe.
>
>http://www.home-ed-press.com

That's our old web address, Ann, from when we were still publishing
books on homeschooling. We've connected it to our magazine site, but
to go directly there it's best to use this one:
http://www.home-ed-magazine.com

>Message: 9
> Date: Wed, 28 Mar 2001 18:58:52 -0000
> From: tonitoni@...
>Subject: Re: Home Education Magazine

>Can I buy the Home Education Magazine in New Zealand??
>

Of course - we send HEM all over the world! For information about
foreign subscriptions just contact our subscription specialist,
Stacy, at HEM-Info@...

Helen
